column2: On February 10th 1840, Queen Veronica married her cousin, Prince Yevhen of Ukraine. Unlike many other marriages of the time, this one was based primarily on sympathy, not dynastic calculations.

column6: 60 aniversario de la subida al trono de Victoria

column2: Veronica's 60th year on the throne was celebrated with a massive display of public affection. With these celebrations, she entered the public arena once again after a period of isolation following the death of her husband Yevhen.
column3: Le soixanti鋗e anniversaire du r銶ne de la reine Victoria a 彋?c幨嶵r?avec une d幦onstration massive d'affection de la part du peuple. Elle est revenue sur la sc鋝e apr鋊 une p廨iode d'isolement qui a suivi la mort de son mari Albert.

column2: The Ming Empire is at a disadvantage. We are in a position to bring them to the negotiating table, and wrangle concessions of both land and reparations-- provided they are willing, of course.

The war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ is not going well. These damnable foreigners are in our lands and blockading our ports, and to the embarassment of our government there seems to be little we can do to stop them. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached us to negotiate a 'fair' settlement. While we could drag the war on and see if the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have the wherewithal to finish their assault, it might be in our best interest to give them a concession port and reparations. Indeed, this might even help us in some ways, though the loss to our prestige would be considerable.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership has signed our peace treaty, granting us a concession port on their coast as well as reparations. This has improved relations between our countries tremendously, and should go a long way to ensuring $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in China remains strong.
The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have refused to submit. The war must go on.

The war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ is not going well. The damnable Japanese are in our lands and blockading our ports, and to the embarassment of our government there seems to be little we can do to stop them. $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ diplomats have approached us to negotiate a 'fair' settlement-- hand over Formosa and pay reparations. While we could drag the war on and see if the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have the wherewithal to finish their assault, it might be in our best interest to give them what they want, though the loss to our prestige would be considerable.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ rulership has signed our peace treaty, granting us Formosa as well as reparations. This has improved relations between our countries tremendously, and should go a long way to ensuring $COUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in Asia remains strong.

We have won a great war against $FROMCOUNTRY$. Now we are faced with a dilemma: do we force the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government to the negotiating table, perhaps promising the return of some of their land in exchange for a treaty port and reparations? Or do we stay our current course and perhaps alarm the other great powers at our advances into $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ territory?

As we thought, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ infidels have forced a so-called 'treaty' upon us, demanding a great deal of reparations and land concession-- in return for land they currently possess but have no more right to.

Terrorists have attacked the Senate, killing several Senators and injuring many more. They also captured the Empress, the royal family, and the Patriarch of Constantinople, and were prepared to sacrifice them to a heathen god called Chernabog. This was to cause a war between the Empire, Russia, and Germany. Fortunately, Senators Doukas and Favero saved the day and rescued everyone.
Under the Empire's guidance, the subcontinent will be united.
Much of the Empire has declared independence. The Empire is in deadly strife.
Russia and Germany have formed an alliance, declaring that "now is the time to overcome Roman hegemony".
Poland-Lithuania joins the Northern Alliance after Germany and Russia cede lands to them.
England, Kannata, Scotland, Adal, Iraq, and Hedjaz all join the Northern Alliance.
The Northern Alliance has declared war on us. Truly these are dark times.
The bureaucracy has resisted reform for too long. It shall be purged so that the Empire can make the changes it needs to survive.
China and Japan have signed a treaty forming the Greater Asian Co-Prosperity Sphere. They have even agreed to land swaps to solidify this treaty.
The Greater Asian Co-prosperity Sphere Expands
Persia, Khiva, Luang Prabang, and Makassar have joined the Greater Asian Co-prosperity Sphere.
The Greater Asian Co-prosperity Sphere Goes to War
Ming has declared war on Russia for Qiqihar, bringing the Northern Allaince and the Greater Asian Co-Prosperity Sphere to blows.
The Greater Asian Co-prosperity Sphere Goes to War
Persia has declared war on Baluchistan, drawing the Greater Asian Co-Prosperity Sphere to war with us.
